newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Three inmates die in Brazil prison riot.
newsitem.headline: Three inmates die in Brazil prison riot.

text.p: Three prisoners were killed on Monday when inmates at a prison in southeastern Brazil rioted after guards foiled their attempt to tunnel to freedom, police said.
"Inmates took 25 hostages and killed three of them," police investigator Odair Moreira told Reuters.
Several convicts were injured in the 12-hour rebellion in the coastal town of Praia Grande, 60 miles (100 km) southeast of Sao Paulo, Moreira said.
The uprising was brought under control at about noon after authorities agreed to transfer some prisoners to ease overcrowding, he said. The prison, built to hold 70 inmates, houses 271, he said.
"They're not back in their cells yet, but everything is calm," Moreira said. "They want to be transferred."
Prisoners began rioting at midnight after jailers discovered a 30-foot (10 metre)-long escape tunnel, he said.
